verses.roman:
śuṇṭhi-khaṇḍa nāḍu, āra āma-pitta-hara
pṛthak pṛthak bāndhi' vastrera kuthalī bhitara

synonyms: śuṇṭhi-khaṇḍa nāḍu—sweetmeat balls made with dried ginger; āra—and; āma-pitta-hara—which removes mucus caused by too much bile; pṛthak pṛthak—separately; bāndhi'-packaging; vastrera—of cloth; kuthalī—small bags; bhitara—within.
translation: She made balls of sweetmeats with dried ginger to remove mucus caused by too much bile. She put all these preparations separately into small cloth bags.
